definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: Yost was an engineer involved in the development of high-altitude weather balloons.
sentences.chinese: 约斯特是一名工程师参与制订高空气象气球。

sentences.english: And nine red balloons hanging on the wall.
sentences.chinese: 墙上还挂着九个红气球。

sentences.english: The air must push onto the balloon.
Helium is a gas used in balloons.
sentences.chinese: 氦是一种用于气球的气体。

sentences.english: Did someone tell you that the balloonist has arrived?
sentences.chinese: 有人告诉你那个热气球飞行家已经来了吗？

sentences.english: Make a suit of furniture by balloons, float them in the room.
sentences.chinese: 做一套气球家具，让它们都漂浮在室内的空间中。

sentences.english: Balloons of all colours are hanging from the lights.
sentences.chinese: 五颜六色的气球从灯上吊下来。

sentences.english: See the four of us and Chichi sitting in the basket of the hot-air balloon.
sentences.chinese: 瞧，我们四个人和奇奇正坐在热气球的篮子里。

sentences.english: These measurements could reach an altitude of 30 kilometres before the balloon burst.
sentences.chinese: 探空气球可升至30公里高才爆裂。

sentences.english: Bite through a inflated balloon by mouth.
sentences.chinese: 用嘴巴把一个充气的气球咬破。

sentences.english: These aerostats have civilian uses, too.
My birthday presents included a doll and a Winnie-the-Pooh balloon.
sentences.chinese: 我的生日礼物有一只玩偶和一只维尼小熊的气球。

sentences.english: Stretch the balloon over the top of the spool.
sentences.chinese: 把气球套在棉线轴的顶部。

sentences.english: If it quacks like a balloon…
sentences.chinese: 如果它像一个气球江湖医生。

sentences.english: Such balloons are made from metal-coated plastic.
sentences.chinese: 那样的气球是由镀上金属的塑胶布做成的。

sentences.english: Immediately upon formation, the fireball begins to grow rapidly and rise like a hot air balloon.
sentences.chinese: 火球在形成之后立刻迅速膨胀并上升，像热气球一样。

definition: toy figurine/action figure/stuffed animal/doll/(fig.) sb's plaything
sky lantern (miniature hot-air balloon used during festivals)
